content_old: 1 And it came to pass on the second-first sabbath, that he went through cornfields, and his disciples were plucking the ears and eating them, rubbing them in their hands.

content: 2 But some of the Pharisees said to them, Why do ye what is not lawful to do on the sabbath?
content_old: 2 But some of the Pharisees said to them, Why do ye what is not lawful to do on the sabbath?

content: 3 And Jesus answering said to them, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did when he hungered, he and those who were with him,
content_old: 3 And Jesus answering said to them, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did when he hungered, he and those who were with him,

content: 4 how he entered into the house of God and took the shewbread and ate, and gave to those also who were with him, which it is not lawful that any eat, unless the priests alone?
content_old: 4 how he entered into the house of God and took the shewbread and ate, and gave to those also who were with him, which it is not lawful that any eat, unless the priests alone?

content: 5 And he said to them, The Son of man is Lord of the sabbath also.
content_old: 5 And he said to them, The Son of man is Lord of the sabbath also.

content: 6 And it came to pass on another sabbath also that he entered into the synagogue and taught; and there was a man there, and his right hand was withered.
content_old: 6 And it came to pass on another sabbath also that he entered into the synagogue and taught; and there was a man there, and his right hand was withered.

content: 7 And the scribes and the Pharisees were watching if he would heal on the sabbath, that they might find something of which to accuse him.
content_old: 7 And the scribes and the Pharisees were watching if he would heal on the sabbath, that they might find something of which to accuse him.

content: 8 But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, Get up, and stand in the midst. And having risen up he stood there.
content_old: 8 But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, Get up, and stand in the midst. And having risen up he stood there.

content: 9 Jesus therefore said to them, I will ask you if it is lawful on the sabbath to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?
content_old: 9 Jesus therefore said to them, I will ask you if it is lawful on the sabbath to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?

content: 10 And having looked around on them all, he said to him, Stretch out thy hand. And he did so and his hand was restored as the other.
content_old: 10 And having looked around on them all, he said to him, Stretch out thy hand. And he did so and his hand was restored as the other.

content: 11 But they were filled with madness, and they spoke together among themselves what they should do to Jesus.
content_old: 11 But they were filled with madness, and they spoke together among themselves what they should do to Jesus.

content: 12 And it came to pass in those days that he went out into the mountain to pray, and he spent the night in prayer to God.
content_old: 12 And it came to pass in those days that he went out into the mountain to pray, and he spent the night in prayer to God.

content: 13 And when it was day he called his disciples, and having chosen out twelve from them, whom also he named apostles:
content_old: 13 And when it was day he called his disciples, and having chosen out twelve from them, whom also he named apostles:

content: 14 Simon, to whom also he gave the name of Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,
content_old: 14 Simon, to whom also he gave the name of Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,

content: 15 and Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus and Simon who was called Zealot,
content_old: 15 and Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus and Simon who was called Zealot,

content: 16 and Judas brother of James, and Judas Iscariote, who was also his betrayer;
content_old: 16 and Judas brother of James, and Judas Iscariote, who was also his betrayer;

content: 17 and having descended with them, he stood on a level place, and a crowd of his disciples, and a great multitude of the people from all Judaea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;
content_old: 17 and having descended with them, he stood on a level place, and a crowd of his disciples, and a great multitude of the people from all Judaea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

content: 18 and those that were beset by unclean spirits were healed.
content_old: 18 and those that were beset by unclean spirits were healed.

content: 19 And all the crowd sought to touch him, for power went out from him and healed all.
content_old: 19 And all the crowd sought to touch him, for power went out from him and healed all.

content: 20 And he, lifting up his eyes upon his disciples, said, Blessed are ye poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.
content_old: 20 And he, lifting up his eyes upon his disciples, said, Blessed are ye poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

content: 21 Blessed ye that hunger now, for ye shall be filled. Blessed ye that weep now, for ye shall laugh.
content_old: 21 Blessed ye that hunger now, for ye shall be filled. Blessed ye that weep now, for ye shall laugh.

content: 22 Blessed are ye when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from them, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as wicked, for the Son of man’s sake:
content_old: 22 Blessed are ye when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from them, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as wicked, for the Son of man’s sake:

content: 23 rejoice in that day and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in the heaven, for after this manner did their fathers act toward the prophets.
content_old: 23 rejoice in that day and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in the heaven, for after this manner did their fathers act toward the prophets.

content: 24 But woe to you rich, for ye have received your consolation.
content_old: 24 But woe to you rich, for ye have received your consolation.

content: 25 Woe to you that are filled, for ye shall hunger. Woe to you who laugh now, for ye shall mourn and weep.
content_old: 25 Woe to you that are filled, for ye shall hunger. Woe to you who laugh now, for ye shall mourn and weep.

content: 26 Woe, when all men speak well of you, for after this manner did their fathers to the false prophets.
content_old: 26 Woe, when all men speak well of you, for after this manner did their fathers to the false prophets.

content: 27 But to you that hear I say, Love your enemies; do good to those that hate you;
content_old: 27 But to you that hear I say, Love your enemies; do good to those that hate you;

content: 28 bless those that curse you; pray for those who use you despitefully.
content_old: 28 bless those that curse you; pray for those who use you despitefully.

content: 29 To him that smites thee on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him that would take away thy garment, forbid not thy body-coat also.
content_old: 29 To him that smites thee on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him that would take away thy garment, forbid not thy body-coat also.

content: 30 To every one that asks of thee, give; and from him that takes away what is thine, ask it not back.
content_old: 30 To every one that asks of thee, give; and from him that takes away what is thine, ask it not back.

content: 31 And as ye wish that men should do to you, do ye also to them in like manner.
content_old: 31 And as ye wish that men should do to you, do ye also to them in like manner.

content: 32 And if ye love those that love you, what thank is it to you? for even sinners love those that love them.
content_old: 32 And if ye love those that love you, what thank is it to you? for even sinners love those that love them.

content: 33 And if ye do good to those that do good to you, what thank is it to you? for even sinners do the same.
content_old: 33 And if ye do good to those that do good to you, what thank is it to you? for even sinners do the same.

content: 34 And if ye lend to those from whom ye hope to receive, what thank is it to you? for even sinners lend to sinners that they may receive the like.
content_old: 34 And if ye lend to those from whom ye hope to receive, what thank is it to you? for even sinners lend to sinners that they may receive the like.

content: 35 But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return, and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be sons of the Highest; for he is good to the unthankful and wicked.
content_old: 35 But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return, and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be sons of the Highest; for he is good to the unthankful and wicked.

content: 36 Be ye therefore merciful, even as your Father also is merciful.
content_old: 36 Be ye therefore merciful, even as your Father also is merciful.

content: 37 And judge not, and ye shall not be judged; condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned. Remit, and it shall be remitted to you.
content_old: 37 And judge not, and ye shall not be judged; condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned. Remit, and it shall be remitted to you.

content: 38 Give, and it shall be given to you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall be given into your bosom: for with the same measure with which ye mete it shall be measured to you again.
content_old: 38 Give, and it shall be given to you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall be given into your bosom: for with the same measure with which ye mete it shall be measured to you again.

content: 39 And he spoke also a parable to them: Can a blind man lead a blind man? shall not both fall into the ditch?
content_old: 39 And he spoke also a parable to them: Can a blind man lead a blind man? shall not both fall into the ditch?

content: 40 The disciple is not above his teacher, but every one that is perfected shall be as his teacher.
content_old: 40 The disciple is not above his teacher, but every one that is perfected shall be as his teacher.

content: 41 But why lookest thou on the mote which is in the eye of thy brother, but perceivest not the beam which is in thine own eye?
content_old: 41 But why lookest thou on the mote which is in the eye of thy brother, but perceivest not the beam which is in thine own eye?

content: 42 or how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, allow me, I will cast out the mote that is in thine eye, thyself not seeing the beam that is in thine eye? Hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine eye, and then thou shalt see clear to cast out the mote which is in the eye of thy brother.
content_old: 42 or how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, allow me, I will cast out the mote that is in thine eye, thyself not seeing the beam that is in thine eye? Hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine eye, and then thou shalt see clear to cast out the mote which is in the eye of thy brother.

content: 43 For there is no good tree which produces corrupt fruit, nor a corrupt tree which produces good fruit;
content_old: 43 For there is no good tree which produces corrupt fruit, nor a corrupt tree which produces good fruit;

content: 44 for every tree is known by its own fruit, for figs are not gathered from thorns, nor grapes vintaged from a bramble.
content_old: 44 for every tree is known by its own fruit, for figs are not gathered from thorns, nor grapes vintaged from a bramble.

content: 45 The good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth good; and the wicked man out of the wicked, brings forth what is wicked: for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
content_old: 45 The good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth good; and the wicked man out of the wicked, brings forth what is wicked: for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.

content: 46 And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things that I say?
content_old: 46 And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things that I say?

content: 47 Every one that comes to me, and hears my words and does them, I will shew you to whom he is like.
content_old: 47 Every one that comes to me, and hears my words and does them, I will shew you to whom he is like.

content: 48 He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock; but a great rain coming, the stream broke upon that house, and could not shake it, for it had been founded on the rock.
content_old: 48 He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock; but a great rain coming, the stream broke upon that house, and could not shake it, for it had been founded on the rock.

content: 1 And when he had completed all his words in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
content_old: 1 And when he had completed all his words in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

content: 2 And a certain centurion’s bondman who was dear to him was ill and about to die;
content_old: 2 And a certain centurion’s bondman who was dear to him was ill and about to die;

content: 3 and having heard of Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, begging him that he might come and save his bondman.
content_old: 3 and having heard of Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, begging him that he might come and save his bondman.

content: 4 But they, being come to Jesus, besought him diligently, saying, He is worthy to whom thou shouldest grant this,
content_old: 4 But they, being come to Jesus, besought him diligently, saying, He is worthy to whom thou shouldest grant this,

content: 5 for he loves our nation, and himself has built the synagogue for us.
content_old: 5 for he loves our nation, and himself has built the synagogue for us.

content: 6 And Jesus went with them. But already, when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent to him friends, saying to him, Lord, do not trouble thyself, for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof.
content_old: 6 And Jesus went with them. But already, when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent to him friends, saying to him, Lord, do not trouble thyself, for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof.

content: 7 Wherefore neither did I count myself worthy to come to thee. But say by a word and my servant shall be healed.
content_old: 7 Wherefore neither did I count myself worthy to come to thee. But say by a word and my servant shall be healed.

content: 8 For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers, and I say to this one, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my bondman, Do this, and he does it.
content_old: 8 For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers, and I say to this one, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my bondman, Do this, and he does it.

content: 9 And Jesus hearing this wondered at him, and turning to the crowd following him said, I say to you, Not even in Israel have I found so great faith.
content_old: 9 And Jesus hearing this wondered at him, and turning to the crowd following him said, I say to you, Not even in Israel have I found so great faith.

content: 10 And they who had been sent returning to the house found the bondman, who was ill, in good health.
content_old: 10 And they who had been sent returning to the house found the bondman, who was ill, in good health.

content: 11 And it came to pass afterwards he went into a city called Nain, and many of his disciples and a great crowd went with him.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass afterwards he went into a city called Nain, and many of his disciples and a great crowd went with him.

content: 12 And as he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, a dead man was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she a widow, and a very considerable crowd of the city was with her.
content_old: 12 And as he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, a dead man was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she a widow, and a very considerable crowd of the city was with her.

content: 13 And the Lord, seeing her, was moved with compassion for her, and said to her, Weep not;
content_old: 13 And the Lord, seeing her, was moved with compassion for her, and said to her, Weep not;

content: 14 and coming up he touched the bier, and the bearers stopped. And he said, Youth, I say to thee, Wake up.
content_old: 14 and coming up he touched the bier, and the bearers stopped. And he said, Youth, I say to thee, Wake up.

content: 15 And the dead sat up and began to speak; and he gave him to his mother.
content_old: 15 And the dead sat up and began to speak; and he gave him to his mother.

content: 16 And fear seized on all, and they glorified God, saying, A great prophet has been raised up amongst us; and God has visited his people.
content_old: 16 And fear seized on all, and they glorified God, saying, A great prophet has been raised up amongst us; and God has visited his people.

content: 17 And this report went out in all Judaea concerning him, and in all the surrounding country.
content_old: 17 And this report went out in all Judaea concerning him, and in all the surrounding country.

content: 18 And the disciples of John brought him word concerning all these things:
content_old: 18 And the disciples of John brought him word concerning all these things:

content: 19 and John, having called two of his disciples, sent to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that is coming, or are we to wait for another?
content_old: 19 and John, having called two of his disciples, sent to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that is coming, or are we to wait for another?

content: 20 But the men having come to him said, John the baptist has sent us to thee, saying, Art thou he that is coming, or are we to wait for another?
content_old: 20 But the men having come to him said, John the baptist has sent us to thee, saying, Art thou he that is coming, or are we to wait for another?

content: 21 In that hour he healed many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits, and to many blind he granted sight.
content_old: 21 In that hour he healed many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits, and to many blind he granted sight.

content: 22 And Jesus answering said to them, Go, bring back word to John of what ye have seen and heard: that blind see, lame walk, lepers are cleansed, deaf hear, dead are raised, poor are evangelized;
content_old: 22 And Jesus answering said to them, Go, bring back word to John of what ye have seen and heard: that blind see, lame walk, lepers are cleansed, deaf hear, dead are raised, poor are evangelized;

content: 23 and blessed is whosoever shall not be offended in me.
content_old: 23 and blessed is whosoever shall not be offended in me.

content: 24 And the messengers of John having departed, he began to speak to the crowds concerning John: What went ye out into the wilderness to behold? a reed shaken by the wind?
content_old: 24 And the messengers of John having departed, he began to speak to the crowds concerning John: What went ye out into the wilderness to behold? a reed shaken by the wind?

content: 25 But what went ye out to see? a man clothed in delicate garments? Behold, those who are in splendid clothing and live luxuriously are in the courts of kings.
content_old: 25 But what went ye out to see? a man clothed in delicate garments? Behold, those who are in splendid clothing and live luxuriously are in the courts of kings.

content: 26 But what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say to you, and what is more excellent than a prophet.
content_old: 26 But what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say to you, and what is more excellent than a prophet.

content: 27 This is he concerning whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee;
content_old: 27 This is he concerning whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee;

content: 28 for I say unto you, Among them that are born of women a greater prophet is no one than John the baptist; but he who is a little one in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
content_old: 28 for I say unto you, Among them that are born of women a greater prophet is no one than John the baptist; but he who is a little one in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

content: 29 (And all the people who heard it, and the tax-gatherers, justified God, having been baptised with the baptism of John;
content_old: 29 (And all the people who heard it, and the tax-gatherers, justified God, having been baptised with the baptism of John;

content: 30 but the Pharisees and the lawyers rendered null as to themselves the counsel of God, not having been baptised by him.)
content_old: 30 but the Pharisees and the lawyers rendered null as to themselves the counsel of God, not having been baptised by him.)

content: 31 To whom therefore shall I liken the men of this generation, and to whom are they like?
content_old: 31 To whom therefore shall I liken the men of this generation, and to whom are they like?

content: 32 They are like children sitting in the market-place, and calling one to another and saying, We have piped to you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.
content_old: 32 They are like children sitting in the market-place, and calling one to another and saying, We have piped to you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.

content: 33 For John the baptist has come neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and ye say, He has a demon.
content_old: 33 For John the baptist has come neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and ye say, He has a demon.

content: 34 The Son of man has come eating and drinking, and ye say, Behold an eater and wine-drinker, a friend of tax-gatherers and sinners;
content_old: 34 The Son of man has come eating and drinking, and ye say, Behold an eater and wine-drinker, a friend of tax-gatherers and sinners;

content: 35 and wisdom has been justified of all her children.
content_old: 35 and wisdom has been justified of all her children.

content: 36 But one of the Pharisees begged him that he would eat with him. And entering into the house of the Pharisee he took his place at table;
content_old: 36 But one of the Pharisees begged him that he would eat with him. And entering into the house of the Pharisee he took his place at table;

content: 37 and behold, a woman in the city, who was a sinner, and knew that he was sitting at meat in the house of the Pharisee, having taken an alabaster box of myrrh,
content_old: 37 and behold, a woman in the city, who was a sinner, and knew that he was sitting at meat in the house of the Pharisee, having taken an alabaster box of myrrh,

content: 38 and standing at his feet behind him weeping, began to wash his feet with tears; and she wiped them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the myrrh.
content_old: 38 and standing at his feet behind him weeping, began to wash his feet with tears; and she wiped them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the myrrh.

content: 39 And the Pharisee who had invited him, seeing it, spoke with himself saying, This person if he were a prophet would have known who and what the woman is who touches him, for she is a sinner.
content_old: 39 And the Pharisee who had invited him, seeing it, spoke with himself saying, This person if he were a prophet would have known who and what the woman is who touches him, for she is a sinner.

content: 40 And Jesus answering said to him, Simon, I have somewhat to say to thee. And he says, Teacher, say it.
content_old: 40 And Jesus answering said to him, Simon, I have somewhat to say to thee. And he says, Teacher, say it.

content: 41 There were two debtors of a certain creditor: one owed five hundred denarii and the other fifty;
content_old: 41 There were two debtors of a certain creditor: one owed five hundred denarii and the other fifty;

content: 42 but as they had nothing to pay, he forgave both of them their debt: say, which of them therefore will love him most?
content_old: 42 but as they had nothing to pay, he forgave both of them their debt: say, which of them therefore will love him most?

content: 43 And Simon answering said, I suppose he to whom he forgave the most. And he said to him, Thou hast rightly judged.
content_old: 43 And Simon answering said, I suppose he to whom he forgave the most. And he said to him, Thou hast rightly judged.

content: 44 And turning to the woman he said to Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thy house; thou gavest me not water on my feet, but she has washed my feet with tears, and wiped them with her hair.
content_old: 44 And turning to the woman he said to Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thy house; thou gavest me not water on my feet, but she has washed my feet with tears, and wiped them with her hair.

content: 45 Thou gavest me not a kiss, but she from the time I came in has not ceased kissing my feet.
content_old: 45 Thou gavest me not a kiss, but she from the time I came in has not ceased kissing my feet.

content: 46 My head with oil thou didst not anoint, but she has anointed my feet with myrrh.
content_old: 46 My head with oil thou didst not anoint, but she has anointed my feet with myrrh.

content: 47 For which cause I say to thee, Her many sins are forgiven; for she loved much; but he to whom little is forgiven loves little.
content_old: 47 For which cause I say to thee, Her many sins are forgiven; for she loved much; but he to whom little is forgiven loves little.

content: 48 And he said to her, Thy sins are forgiven.
content_old: 48 And he said to her, Thy sins are forgiven.

content: 49 And they that were with them at table began to say within themselves, Who is this who forgives also sins?
content_old: 49 And they that were with them at table began to say within themselves, Who is this who forgives also sins?

content: 1 And it came to pass afterwards that he went through the country city by city, and village by village, preaching and announcing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God; and the twelve were with him,
content_old: 1 And it came to pass afterwards that he went through the country city by city, and village by village, preaching and announcing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God; and the twelve were with him,

content: 2 and certain women who had been healed of wicked spirits and infirmities, Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,
content_old: 2 and certain women who had been healed of wicked spirits and infirmities, Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,

content: 3 and Joanna, wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, who ministered to him of their substance.
content_old: 3 and Joanna, wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, who ministered to him of their substance.

content: 4 And a great crowd coming together, and those who were coming to him out of each city, he spoke by parable:
content_old: 4 And a great crowd coming together, and those who were coming to him out of each city, he spoke by parable:

content: 5 The sower went out to sow his seed; and as he sowed, some fell along the way, and it was trodden under foot, and the birds of the heaven devoured it up;
content_old: 5 The sower went out to sow his seed; and as he sowed, some fell along the way, and it was trodden under foot, and the birds of the heaven devoured it up;

content: 6 and other fell upon the rock, and having sprung up, it was dried up because it had not moisture;
content_old: 6 and other fell upon the rock, and having sprung up, it was dried up because it had not moisture;

content: 7 and other fell in the midst of the thorns, and the thorns having sprung up with it choked it;
content_old: 7 and other fell in the midst of the thorns, and the thorns having sprung up with it choked it;

content: 8 and other fell into the good ground, and having sprung up bore fruit a hundredfold. As he said these things he cried, He that has ears to hear, let him hear.
content_old: 8 and other fell into the good ground, and having sprung up bore fruit a hundredfold. As he said these things he cried, He that has ears to hear, let him hear.

content: 9 And his disciples asked him saying, What may this parable be?
content_old: 9 And his disciples asked him saying, What may this parable be?

content: 10 And he said, To you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the rest in parables, in order that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.
content_old: 10 And he said, To you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the rest in parables, in order that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.

content: 11 But the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
content_old: 11 But the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

content: 12 But those by the wayside are those who hear; then comes the devil and takes away the word from their heart that they may not believe and be saved.
content_old: 12 But those by the wayside are those who hear; then comes the devil and takes away the word from their heart that they may not believe and be saved.

content: 13 But those upon the rock, those who when they hear receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who believe for a time, and in time of trial fall away.
content_old: 13 But those upon the rock, those who when they hear receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who believe for a time, and in time of trial fall away.

content: 14 But that that fell where the thorns were, these are they who having heard go away and are choked under cares and riches and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to perfection.
content_old: 14 But that that fell where the thorns were, these are they who having heard go away and are choked under cares and riches and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

content: 15 But that in the good ground, these are they who in an honest and good heart, having heard the word keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.
content_old: 15 But that in the good ground, these are they who in an honest and good heart, having heard the word keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.

content: 16 And no one having lighted a lamp covers it with a vessel or puts it under a couch, but sets it on a lamp-stand, that they who enter in may see the light.

content: 10 But when thou hast been invited, go and put thyself down in the last place, that when he who has invited thee comes, he may say to thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have honour before all that are lying at table with thee;
